Present location: BIBLIOTHECA ALEXANDRINA ANTIQUETIES MUSEUM [01/027] ALEXANDRIA BAAM
Name: Clay Sarcophagus
Description: A poorly made clay sarcophagus, probably made for a man, as the hair appears to be cut short with small curls. The sarcophagus is decorated with geometrical and floral drawings; they consist of long wide lines, which are intersected with brown lines. The sarcophagus is in two parts; the smaller part, which forms the chest and head, is separate from the rest of the sarcophagus.
